_note: This is SOURCE DATA for import, not a direct database dump. The sync script (lib/jobs/sync-agency-catalogs.server.ts) transforms this into agency_course_templates records. BSAC uses a progressive grade system with Skill Development Courses (SDCs) for specialization.

courses.name: Discovery Diver
courses.description: BSAC's entry-level certification for those with limited time who want to become certified divers. Ideal for divers who expect to dive primarily with a guide. Learn essential underwater skills and safety principles.
courses.prerequisites: Must comfortably swim 200m in a pool

courses.name: Ocean Diver
courses.description: BSAC's fundamental open water certification equipping divers with skills for underwater exploration to 20 metres. Comprehensive training covering equipment use, buoyancy control, safety principles, and dive planning. Valid for diving in the UK and internationally.
courses.prerequisites: Must comfortably swim 200m in a pool
requiredItems: Basic equipment provided, personal gear recommended

courses.name: Advanced Ocean Diver
courses.description: Bridge certification between Ocean Diver and Sports Diver, enabling divers to expand exploration capabilities to 30 metres depth. Includes nitrox training, compass navigation, and surface marker buoy deployment skills.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent certification, completed Nitrox training

courses.name: Sports Diver
courses.description: Key advancement certification enabling longer, deeper dives to 40 metres with decompression stops. Comprehensive rescue training including self-rescue and recovery of unresponsive divers. In-water decompression procedures and extended nitrox use.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or Advanced Ocean Diver, or equivalent from another recognized agency. Age 14+ required to progress beyond 20m depth post-qualification.

courses.name: Dive Leader
courses.description: Leadership certification enabling experienced divers to lead groups and develop rescue management skills. Learn dive planning, management, and coordination of rescue responses. Prerequisite for Open Water Instructor training.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent, valid nitrox qualification, minimum 60 dives in varied conditions

courses.name: Advanced Diver
courses.description: Advanced leadership certification for experienced divers ready to lead diving expeditions and manage challenging activities. Advanced Divers are role models in BSAC clubs, able to lead groups in new situations, remote locations, and detailed planning scenarios.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Dive Leader or equivalent, minimum 20 open-water experience dives, 600 minutes underwater time, led at least 10 qualifying dives as Dive Leader, managed at least 5 qualifying dives as Dive Manager

courses.name: First Class Diver
courses.description: BSAC's highest diving grade reflecting extensive theoretical knowledge, organizational skills, and dive management expertise. First Class Divers demonstrate capability to lead safe yet challenging expeditions and diving projects.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Advanced Diver, minimum 100 dives in varying conditions (minimum 20 dives exceeding 30m depth), completed six mandatory SDCs: Chartwork and Position Fixing, Diver Coxswain Award, Oxygen Administration, Practical Rescue Management, Advanced Lifesaver, First Aid for Divers

courses.name: Accelerated Decompression Procedures
courses.description: Learn to use oxygen-rich decompression mixes to optimize off-gassing at decompression stops. Covers diving physics, physiology, kit configuration for redundancy, BSAC Ox-stop tables, and stage-cylinder diving techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with 35m depth certification and nitrox training, demonstrated Gold standard buoyancy (+0.5m), minimum 20 logged dives as Sports Diver, depth experience to at least 30m
requiredItems: Full open-water dive kit (single or twin-cylinder)

courses.name: Buoyancy and Trim Workshop
courses.description: Develop optimum underwater position and control through relaxation techniques. One theory session and two open-water dives teaching the value of control for safer, more enjoyable diving.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Compressor Operation
courses.description: Learn safe operation and maintenance of diving compressors. Essential knowledge for club compressor operators covering air quality, safety procedures, and equipment care.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership

courses.name: Deeper Diver
courses.description: Extend diving capabilities on open circuit equipment to 50 metres depth. Theory covers diving physics, physiology, decompression planning, and gas planning. Enables use of weak trimix and progression toward technical diving.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Dive Leader or equivalent with nitrox certification, qualified to plan and complete decompression diving

courses.name: Dive Planning and Management
courses.description: Comprehensive course covering dive site selection, risk assessment, buddy pairing, and contingency planning. Essential skills for organizing safe and enjoyable club diving activities.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Marine Life Appreciation
courses.description: One-day course educating participants about underwater environments and conservation. Covers marine creature groups, marine science processes, human impact on the marine environment, and diver conservation responsibilities.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership only - no diving qualification required

courses.name: Nitrox Gas Blender
courses.description: Learn the theory and practical skills for safely blending nitrox gas mixtures. Covers oxygen handling, partial pressure blending, continuous blending, and gas analysis procedures.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with nitrox qualification or equivalent

courses.name: Mixed Gas Blender
courses.description: Advanced gas blending course covering trimix and heliox preparation. Learn helium handling, complex gas calculations, and safe blending procedures for technical diving gases.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Nitrox Gas Blender qualification

courses.name: Search and Recovery
courses.description: Learn underwater recovery techniques using reels, lines, weights, buoys, and lifting bags. Covers simple, controlled, staged, and multiple bag lifting techniques along with search pattern planning.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Wreck Appreciation
courses.description: Learn to recognize and safely navigate wreck features. Recognized by the Nautical Archaeology Society. Covers wreck identification, legal protections, basic site sketching, and specialized equipment techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Wreck Diver
courses.description: Introduction to safe wreck diving techniques. Learn wreck types, wreck law, equipment use, line-laying techniques, and non-penetration wreck dive planning.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent, ability to safely conduct direct ascent to surface at any point

courses.name: Advanced Wreck Diver
courses.description: Advanced wreck diving techniques including limited penetration skills. Covers wreck penetration planning, emergency procedures, line-laying for penetration, and advanced wreck navigation.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Wreck Diver SDC, Dive Leader or equivalent

courses.name: Twin-set Diver
courses.description: Introduction to self-sufficient buddy diving with twin cylinders. Great course for extending gas supplies and introduction to equipment used for safer planned decompression diving.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent, minimum 20 logged dives as Sports Diver

courses.name: Primary Donate Workshop
courses.description: Learn the primary donate gas sharing technique for improved safety. Covers equipment configuration, emergency response procedures, and practical skills for sharing gas with a distressed diver.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent
requiredItems: Full open-water dive kit with long hose configuration

courses.name: Drysuit Training
courses.description: Essential training for diving in drysuit conditions. Covers suit selection, buoyancy control, emergency procedures, and care and maintenance of drysuit equipment.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Ocean Diver Nitrox Workshop
courses.description: Introduction to nitrox diving for Ocean Divers. Learn the benefits and limitations of enriched air diving up to 36% oxygen mixture.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver

courses.name: Sports Diver Nitrox Workshop
courses.description: Extended nitrox training for Sports Divers covering advanced applications and higher oxygen percentages for decompression optimization.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with Ocean Diver Nitrox qualification

courses.name: Oxygen Administration
courses.description: Essential safety training in oxygen delivery procedures for diving emergencies. Learn to administer oxygen to injured divers and manage emergency oxygen equipment.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership

courses.name: Practical Rescue Management
courses.description: One-day course developing rescue management skills through realistic scenarios. Learn strategic incident assessment, prioritization, delegation, casualty removal, first aid priorities, and emergency services coordination.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Automated External Defibrillator (AED)
courses.description: Training on using AED equipment for cardiac emergency response. Learn when and how to use an AED effectively in diving emergency situations.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership

courses.name: Lifesaver Award
courses.description: Foundational rescue qualification covering rescue fundamentals for divers. Learn in-water rescue techniques, towing methods, and basic casualty management.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Advanced Lifesaver Award
courses.description: Advanced rescue qualification building on the standard Lifesaver Award. Covers complex rescue scenarios, multiple casualty management, and advanced towing techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Lifesaver Award, Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: First Aid for Divers
courses.description: First aid instruction tailored specifically to diving-related medical emergencies. Covers decompression sickness recognition, near-drowning response, and marine life injuries.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership

courses.name: RNLI Diver Sea Survival Workshop
courses.description: Partnership course with the Royal National Lifeboat Institution covering survival skills for divers at sea. Learn sea survival techniques, signaling, and rescue coordination.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Ocean Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Boat Handling
courses.description: Practical boat-based course teaching operation of rigid-hulled inflatable boats (RIBs) for diving operations. Covers high-speed and slow-speed maneuvering, anchoring, launching, recovering boats, and diver deployment.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership - no diving qualification required

courses.name: Chartwork and Position Fixing
courses.description: Hands-on navigation course for planning diving expeditions. Learn to read nautical charts, calculate tidal movements, determine positions at sea, and identify potential dive sites.
courses.prerequisites: None - open to anyone including non-divers

courses.name: Diver Coxswain Assessment
courses.description: Assessment course for demonstrating competency in commanding and managing a diving vessel. Covers boat handling skills, crew management, and dive operation coordination from the helm.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Boat Handling SDC, extensive practical boat handling experience

courses.name: Underwater Photography
courses.description: Introduction to underwater photography using digital cameras. Combines theoretical instruction with practical underwater application and post-processing training. Covers optical issues, camera features, and shooting techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent, very familiar with diving equipment, able to control buoyancy within one metre of any depth

courses.name: Ice Diving
courses.description: Specialized training for diving in ice environments. Covers ice diving hazards, line procedures, emergency responses, and equipment considerations for cold water diving.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Dive Leader or equivalent with extensive cold water experience

courses.name: Underwater Surveyor
courses.description: Created in partnership with Seawilding to enable divers to get involved in protecting the ocean and its habitats. Learn survey techniques, data recording, and species identification for conservation purposes.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Shore Surveyor
courses.description: Training for surveying coastal and shore diving locations. Learn to assess dive sites, identify hazards, and document conditions for safe shore diving operations.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership - no diving qualification required

courses.name: Diving for All Awareness
courses.description: Program focused on inclusive diving practices. Learn about adaptive diving techniques and how to support divers with disabilities in enjoying underwater activities.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC membership

courses.name: BSAC Beachcomber
courses.description: Children's course exploring the intertidal zone and marine life along the shore. Fun, educational introduction to marine environments without diving.

courses.name: Sport Mixed Gas Diver
courses.description: BSAC's entry-level open circuit technical course introducing experienced ADP divers to trimix as a breathing gas. Qualify to dive trimix mixes to depths up to 50m using twin-set and single stage cylinder.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with 35m depth certification and ADP course, minimum 60 logged dives with 10 dives between 30-35m
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and fitness assessment required

courses.name: Explorer Mixed Gas Diver
courses.description: Extend open-circuit mixed gas diving skills to 60m. Learn to use travel gas to optimize breathing mix at all dive stages. Introduces normoxic trimix diving with twin-set and two stage cylinders.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sport Mixed Gas Diver (50m) or equivalent with suitable experience
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and fitness assessment required

courses.name: Advanced Mixed Gas Diver
courses.description: Ultimate step in BSAC open-circuit mixed-gas training. Introduces extended choice of trimix gases and qualifies divers to 80m depth using twin-set and minimum two stage cylinders.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sport Mixed Gas Diver (50m) or Explorer Mixed Gas Diver (60m) with extensive experience
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and fitness assessment required

courses.name: Poseidon Se7en CCR Diver
courses.description: Entry-level closed circuit rebreather course for the Poseidon Se7en unit. Learn rebreather theory, unit-specific operations, emergency procedures, and qualify for CCR diving to 40m depth.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with 35m depth certification, minimum 50 logged dives
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: AP Vision CCR Diver
courses.description: Entry-level closed circuit rebreather course for the AP Vision unit. Comprehensive training in rebreather diving to 45m depth with unit-specific procedures and emergency responses.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with 35m depth certification, minimum 50 logged dives
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: Divesoft Liberty CCR Diver
courses.description: Entry-level closed circuit rebreather certification for the Divesoft Liberty unit. Learn unit-specific operations and qualify for CCR diving to 45m depth.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver with 35m depth certification, minimum 50 logged dives
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: MOD 1 AP Mixed Gas Top-up
courses.description: Top-up qualification for AP Vision CCR divers enabling mixed gas operations. Extends CCR capability with trimix diluent options to 45m depth.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC AP Vision CCR Diver certification
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: MOD 2 CCR Diver
courses.description: Intermediate CCR progression course extending rebreather capability to 60m depth. Covers advanced trimix operations, complex decompression, and emergency management.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC CCR Diver (40m/45m) with extensive CCR experience
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: Advanced Mixed Gas CCR Diver
courses.description: Ultimate step in BSAC closed-circuit mixed-gas training. Introduces extended trimix options and qualifies for CCR diving to 100m depth. High proficiency required with 80-100 logged CCR dives.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC CCR Diver (40m) or Sport Mixed Gas CCR Diver (50m), demonstrated high CCR proficiency with 80-100 logged CCR dives
courses.medicalRequirements: BSAC Medical Declaration and comprehensive CCR fitness assessment required

courses.name: Instructor Foundation Course
courses.description: Entry point into BSAC instructor training. Two-day course covering teaching principles, lesson planning, and practical pool instruction skills. Successful candidates become Assistant Diving Instructors.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Open Water Instructor
courses.description: Second level of instructor training extending teaching abilities from pool to open water. One-day course focusing on preparing and delivering practical skills lessons in open water environments.
courses.prerequisites: Completed Instructor Foundation Course, BSAC Dive Leader or equivalent
requiredItems: Single cylinder dive kit with demand valve and alternative air source

courses.name: Theory Instructor Exam
courses.description: Half-day examination assessing competency in teaching diving theory. Required component for full Open Water Instructor qualification.
courses.prerequisites: Completed Open Water Instructor Course, BSAC Dive Leader or equivalent

courses.name: Practical Instructor Exam
courses.description: Half-day practical examination assessing open water instructing competency. Completes the pathway to full Open Water Instructor qualification.
courses.prerequisites: Passed Theory Instructor Exam, completed Open Water Instructor Course

courses.name: Advanced Instructor
courses.description: Third level of BSAC instructor training. Two-day course enabling experienced instructors to teach advanced diving skills including boat management, wreck finding, chart navigation, and project leadership.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Open Water Instructor, BSAC Advanced Diver or equivalent

courses.name: National Instructor
courses.description: BSAC's highest instructor qualification. Rigorous preparation through five national prep events and four-day examination. National Instructors lead training development and bring forward new courses.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Advanced Instructor, First Class Diver, active Instructor Trainer, Pass or Merit in First Class Diver theory exam within past 3 years

courses.name: Instructor Development Course
courses.description: Enhancement course for qualified Open Water Instructors or Club Instructors. Develops advanced instructing capabilities and teaching techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Open Water Instructor or Club Instructor

courses.name: Instructor Crossover Course
courses.description: Enables instructors from other diving agencies to transfer qualifications to BSAC. Covers BSAC-specific procedures, training standards, and assessment methods.
courses.prerequisites: Current instructor certification from another recognized training agency, Dive Leader equivalent qualification

courses.name: Twin-set Instructor Workshop
courses.description: Qualifies experienced twin-set divers to teach equipment usage. Covers twin-set configuration, teaching methods, and assessment criteria for Twin-set Diver course.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Open Water Instructor, Twin-set Diver qualification with extensive experience

courses.name: Technical Instructor
courses.description: Qualification to teach BSAC technical diving courses. Covers advanced instruction methods for mixed gas and CCR training programs.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Advanced Instructor with technical diving qualifications (Mixed Gas or CCR)

courses.name: Instructor Trainer Development Course
courses.description: Prepares experienced instructors to train and assess new instructors. Covers instructor training methodology, assessment standards, and mentoring techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Advanced Instructor with extensive teaching experience

courses.name: Diving for All Instructor
courses.description: Qualification to teach and support divers with disabilities. Covers adaptive techniques, equipment modifications, and inclusive teaching methods.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Open Water Instructor, Diving for All Awareness SDC

courses.name: Dolphin Snorkeller
courses.description: Fun snorkelling course for younger children featuring seven lively in-water sessions themed around different dolphin types. Participants earn dolphin stickers to become a BSAC Dolphin Snorkeller.

courses.name: Snorkel Diver
courses.description: Entry-level snorkelling certification for individuals, families, and children aged 8+. Covers core skills for safe, fun snorkelling with a buddy in sheltered water conditions.
courses.prerequisites: Must be able to swim 50 metres and be comfortable in water
requiredItems: Mask, snorkel, and fins (can be provided)

courses.name: Advanced Snorkeller
courses.description: Develops self-reliance, safety-awareness, and readiness for varied conditions. Advanced theory and open-water snorkelling including navigation, marker buoys, and search techniques.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Snorkel Diver

courses.name: Snorkel Dive Manager
courses.description: Leadership qualification teaching how to safely organize, manage, and supervise group snorkelling activities. Covers session planning, condition assessment, group briefing, and incident handling.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Advanced Snorkeller with extensive snorkelling experience

courses.name: Snorkel Lifesaver Award
courses.description: Rescue qualification designed specifically for snorkellers. Learn in-water rescue techniques appropriate for snorkelling environments.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Snorkel Diver

courses.name: Advanced Snorkel Lifesaver Award
courses.description: Advanced rescue qualification for experienced snorkellers. Covers complex rescue scenarios in open water environments.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Snorkel Lifesaver Award, Advanced Snorkeller

courses.name: Snorkel Instructor
courses.description: Primary snorkel instructor certification through the Snorkel Instructor Training Course and Assessment (SITCA). Qualifies to teach BSAC snorkel programs.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Snorkel Diver

courses.name: Advanced Snorkel Instructor
courses.description: Advanced snorkel instructor qualification enabling teaching of higher-level snorkel courses and supervising less experienced instructors.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Snorkel Instructor, Snorkel Dive Manager, Advanced Snorkel Lifesaver Award

courses.name: Try Dive
courses.description: Introductory diving experience for those curious about scuba diving. Safe, supervised pool session to experience breathing underwater with full instruction and equipment provided.

courses.name: Scuba Refresher
courses.description: Refresher course for certified divers returning to diving after a break. Reviews essential skills, safety procedures, and rebuilds confidence in the water.
courses.prerequisites: Existing diving certification from any recognized agency
requiredItems: Personal dive equipment or rental available

courses.name: CCR Try Dive
courses.description: Introductory experience with closed circuit rebreather diving. A taster session before committing to full CCR certification courses.
courses.prerequisites: BSAC Sports Diver or equivalent
